item.title: MultiVersus Showcases Anticipated New Stage
item.description:
Highlights

  • MultiVersus showcases Dexter's Laboratory stage, adding to Warner Bros. universe reference maps.
  • The new Dexter's Lab stage features two versions, including a procedurally generated stage with unique elements for each match.
  • Players anticipate Dexter's potential entry into the MultiVersus roster, along with leaks hinting at a Powerpuff Girls addition.

MultiVersus has released a new trailer showcasing Dexter's Laboratory, one of the game's upcoming stages. MultiVersus revealed the Dexter's Laboratory stage for the first time at the beginning of the year, and since then, players have been eagerly awaiting its release. It will join the stages that, like the MultiVersus characters, reference the universe of Warner Bros. properties.

Warner Bros released several maps during the beta, and each of these MultiVersus maps supported different game modes. The Sky Arena, a reference to Steven Universe , was a highlight for offering players great potential to perform combos and the most varied types of plays. The Tree Fort from Adventure Time has two variants, one for 4v4 battles and the other for 2v2 skirmishes. Like some other Warner Brothers games, the Batcave is in MultiVersus , with a middle arena that usually results in shorter matches. MultiVersus continues its streak of pre-launch reveals and finally showcases an anticipated stage.

Related
Why Brawlhalla is a Different Breed From MultiVersus

Though they're both colorful platform-fighters with a cartoon-y art style, Brawlhalla and MultiVersus have one key difference that sets them apart.

MultiVersus has shared a new trailer showcasing the upcoming Dexter's Laboratory stage . The trailer reveals that the stage will have two versions, the first being a procedurally generated stage that scrolls infinitely. Because of the procedural generation, the stage will be different from match to match. The map contains random modules, and they have gadgets, buttons, conveyors, diodes, tubes, and holo-platforms. The second version offers a competitive experience, with a stage that has Super Smash Bros .-esque platforms and the laboratory in the background, with Dee Dee running around.

Could Dexter Be on His Way to MultiVersus?

With Dexter's Laboratory stage confirmed, MultiVersus players now hope for Dexter to join the game as one of the playable characters. While MultiVersus has yet to announce Dexter's entry into the roster, leaks hint that he will be added at some point. The odds have increased with the release of the launch trailer, which features a Dexter's Laboratory reference. The same trailer also has an Easter egg that teases the Powerpuff Girls in MultiVersus , another highly anticipated addition.

The journey to MultiVersus ' launch day has been paved by exciting announcements, such as Jason Voorhees as a playable fighter, along with Agent Smith from The Matrix and Mark Hamill's Joker. MultiVersus revealed rewards for returning players , a preview of the Season 1 Battle Pass, adjustments to the game's combat, and a new monetization system. With May 28 drawing ever closer, MultiVersus players look forward to seeing what the game's launch and first season will be like.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Crochets Adorable Sleepy Psyduck
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon fans express creativity through traditional crafting, like crochet, to create adorable fan art of beloved creatures.
  • Psyduck's popularity stems from the Pokemon anime series, with its quirky behavior and psychic powers making it a fan favorite.
  • Despite Junichi Masuda's love for Psyduck, the Pokemon has never received a regional variant or unique form, leaving fans hopeful for more in future games.

A Pokemon fan has created an adorable sleepy Psyduck through crochet. The plush looks perfect for anyone who loves Psyduck, the headache-ridden Pokemon with psychic powers.

Pokemon fans create fan art of their favorite creatures all the time, and some of them utilize traditional crafting techniques to create designs like these. Crochet, embroidery, and even quilting with Pokemon themes have been explored over the years, and creative fans show no signs of slowing down.

Related
Pokemon Fan Shows Off Incredible Psyduck Renaissance Painting

A talented Pokemon enthusiast posts an artistic Renaissance-style rendering of Psyduck, a much beloved Generation 1 Pokemon.

Now, a Pokemon fan going by the name of lalisajaa on Reddit or fonsahh on Instagram has shared their own adorable crochet creation of Psyduck. The sleepy Psyduck has its eyes closed and is seated, with its back flippers up in front of its belly. Its wings/arms are down at its sides, and it looks like the Pokemon is sleeping peacefully, perhaps getting a break from its chronic headaches. Lalisajaa noted that they felt like everyone could related to a sleepy Psyduck, and fans were charmed by the design.

This Psyduck crochet is a type of Amigurumi, which is the art of creating plush toys through crochet. The three-dimensional creations have been made with Pokemon before, with everything from Gengar to Kingdra getting the crochet treatment. It's a unique alternate take on the typical Pokemon plush toys one might find at a store like Build-a-Bear , which tend to use soft fleece fabric for the exterior of the Pokemon.

Psyduck's Enduring Popularity Isn't Based on New Forms

Psyduck is a Gen 1 Pokemon that attained much of its fame and popularity thanks to its presence as a Pokemon of Misty in the Pokemon anime series. Psyduck was notorious for popping out of its Poke Ball at will when least expected - or wanted, depending on the situation - sometimes serving as comedic relief, and othertimes saving the day due to its headache triggering its psychic abilities.

Psyduck is quite popular. Pokemon dev Junichi Masuda has even declared Psyduck as his favorite , going so far as to enter tournaments with the Duck Pokemon. Despite this fondness, though, Psyduck has never received a regional variant or a unique form like a Mega Evolution or Gigantamax. While it could Dynamax in Pokemon Sword and Shield like every Pokemon in the entry, some fans are likely hoping that Psyduck will get some additional attention in future games. It remains to be seen if Psyduck will make an appearance in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , but with the return of Mega Evolutions, it might be the Pokemon icon's time to shine.

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals When Fall Guys Crossover Could Happen
item.description:
Highlights

  • According to a leak, the Fortnite x Fall Guys collab may drop on June 17, potentially adding new gameplay mechanics and skins.
  • Speculation includes a Fall Guys mini-game in the Battle Royale mode with Pegwins as obstacles.
  • Fortnite is known for collabs with popular IPs like Marvel and Star Wars.

A Fortnite x Fall Guys collab might be arriving on June 17, according to reputable Fortnite leakers. A trailer announcing the Fortnite crossover was posted on YouTube in March, and since then, many gamers have been excited for more details. A great deal of Fortnite players are now eagerly speculating about the potential new gameplay mechanics, skins, and other unique features that this crossover could introduce.

One of Fortnite ’s greatest assets is the constant collaborations between the game and numerous other popular intellectual properties, such as Marvel, Star Wars , and Stranger Things . Sometimes, Fortnit e also uses partnerships with other video games in order to make some unique spinoffs via Fortnite ’s own engine. One such example is the game’s collab with Rocket League, which added a fast-paced racing mode that can be played inside Fortnite , with some purchased cosmetics and cars being cross-shared between the two games.

Related
Fortnite Leaks Fall Guys-Inspired Feature Coming This Year

Fortnite leakers say that a major Fall Guys-inspired feature is coming to Fortnite as part of the previously leaked crossover event.

According to ShiinaBR and Krowe_moh on Twitter, the Fortnite x Fall Guys collab will be released as early as June 17. A partnership between Fall Guys and Fortnite has been teased several times throughout the past months, as many gaming news leakers have shared some interesting details about the possible partnership. Moreover, a pink Fall Guy bean has also been spotted during the battle royale's gigantic Big Bang event .

What Could Fortnite x Fall Guys Look Like?

A lot of gamers have been speculating about what a Fall Guys crossover could bring to the Fortnite universe. Fortnite leakers Wensoing and Loolo_WRLD claimed that there will be a special minigame added to the Battle Royale mode that will be similar to the Mothership Abduction one which was introduced in Fortnite ’s Chapter 2 Season 7. Players would have to go through an obstacle course like in Fall Guys while being chased by little penguin-like creatures called Pegwins. However, until Epic confirms any of these features, the aforementioned rumors should be taken with a grain of salt.

Other fans believe that a few ingenious Fall Guys -themed items, such as trampolines and obstacles, will also be there to play around with in Fortnite ’s Creative Mode . Of course, a lot of players are hopeful that the cosmetics earned in the original Fall Guys will be available to access inside Fortnite once the collab officially starts. It appears that a lot of excitement is in the air as the potential release date of June 17 approaches, and many gamers are eagerly waiting for official details to come.

item.title: Rumor: World of Warcraft May Not Be Done Addressing Frog Farming in Mists of Pandaria Remix
item.description:
Highlights

  • World of Warcraft adds new player tags to database, potentially targeting frog farmers in Mists of Pandaria Remix event.
  • WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria event allows players to farm Gulp Frogs for currencies, nerfed efficiency shortly after.
  • CriteriaTree entries may lead to rewards or rollbacks for frog farming, addressing ongoing issues in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria.

World of Warcraft has added a few new player tags to its CriteriaTree database, suggesting it is trying to identify characters who farmed Gulp Frogs in the Mists of Pandaria Remix event. Though it could amount to nothing, Blizzard might not be completely done addressing frog farmers in the World of Warcraft event.

WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria is a throwback event where players can experience the old expansion with modern convenience. In order to farm the event’s currencies, some World of Warcraft fans rediscovered the Gulp Frog – an enemy on the Timeless Isle that was once farmed in the original Mists of Pandaria . Unfortunately, World of Warcraft nerfed the efficiency of Remix frog farming not long after it began.

Related
World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria Makes It Easier to Get a Shirt and Tabard

World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria players looking to make the perfect transmog can now pick up a shirt and tabard without any trouble.

However, it seems like World of Warcraft might be planning to do something about frog farming in the future. As discovered by Wowhead , World of Warcraft added some new entries in the WoW CriteriaTree database in a series of hotfixes on May 21. This new data seemingly identifies if a player participated in frog farming before it was nerfed in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria for some purpose.

History of Frog Farming in WoW: Mists of Pandaria

  • Gulp Frogs are an Elite enemy on the Timeless Isle who drop various currencies, including Lesser Charms of Good Fortune, cloak threads, and Bronze in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria .
  • Farming Gulp Frogs was popular in the original Mists of Pandaria to acquire Timeless Coins and Sha Crystals, and has returned again in WoW Remix .
  • Because they spawn in a small location, they can be killed quickly, tricking the game into thinking it is a high traffic area to spawn them rapidly.
  • World of Warcraft recently nerfed frog farming by removing Lesser Charms of Good Fortune from their loot tables in Mists of Pandaria Remix .

It is unlikely that this will be a prelude to banning World of Warcraft players who farmed frogs before the nerf , as CriteriaTree is usually used to track in-game statistics like achievement progress. It is possible these data entries will be used to give a reward to characters who didn’t get the boost from frog farming, roll back accounts that did, create a new achievement, or track information for internal use only. It is entirely possible fans will never see anything come of these new hotfixes.

Either way, problems that led to the frog farming fiasco of WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria remain. The steep Bronze costs of both upgrading items and purhcasing the abundance of cosmetic rewards in the game mode has led players to desperately search for easy ways to farm currency, only for most of the exploits to be fixed shortly after. World of Warcraft has promised to make the endgame more rewarding , so hopefully these fixes can help fans as the event continues.

item.title: Artist Designs More Pokemon in How to Train Your Dragon Art Style
item.description:
Highlights

  • A talented fan creates Dragon-type Pokemon inspired by How to Train Your Dragon's art style.
  • Dr_Doodle_Phd unveiled Salamence, Applin, Alolan Exeggutor, and Dragapult in unique designs.
  • Many Pokemon fans love crossover fan art, with Pokemon reimagined in various popular franchises' styles.

A talented Pokemon fan has recently designed four Dragon-type creatures using the art style of How to Train Your Dragon . Pokemon fans love crossovers, and How to Train Your Dragon provides quite a unique art style to use as an inspiration.

How to Train Your Dragon is an animated movie originally released in 2010. The movie was popular, spawning two sequels, a few short movies, and even a How To Train Your Dragon live-action movie , which is currently in development. Due to the huge popularity of the series, one fan decided to create a collection of Dragon-type Pokemon inspired by the franchise.

Related
Pokemon Fan Designs Prehistoric Versions for Pidgey and Its Evolutions

A talented Pokemon fan reimagines the Normal/Flying-type Pidgey and its evolutions Pidgeotto and Pidgeot as prehistoric creatures.

Now, the Pokemon fan Dr_Doodle_Phd revealed their latest creations: new versions of Salamence, Applin, Alolan Exeggutor, and Dragapult inspired by How to Train Your Dragon ’s art style. While the overall form of each creature does not change drastically in these new art pieces, all of these new designs are greatly stylized and have unique dragon heads. For example, Salamence still has mostly the same body, but its head is different due to a new mouth and horns. Dragapult became somewhat rounder, and Applin was turned into a lizard-like creature carrying an apple. Possibly the most interesting design was the Alolan Exeggutor, who gained dragon wings and heads that no longer resemble coconuts, but full-fledged dragons.

Dragon-Type Pokemon Reimagined in How to Train Your Dragon's Style

This is not the first time that Dr_Doodle_Phd unveils a collection of stunning Pokemon fan art. The artist started to create Pokemon inspired by How to Train Your Dragon a few weeks ago when they shared fan art of Flygon, Noivern, Garchomp, and Dragonite with fans of Nintendo’s franchise.

Unofficial crossovers between Pokemon and other popular franchises are quite common in fan art. For instance, one fan designed Pokemon inspired by Lilo and Stitch ’s style some time ago, sharing unique versions of Latias, Latios, Pichu, Nidoran (male and female), Golduck, and Zorua with the community.

Not all Pokemon fan art featuring the art style of other franchises is based on movies, though. Back in March, another Pokemon fan redesigned Reshiram in Monster Hunter ’s art style . The result was an interesting take on the mythic dragon creature, which was quite distinct from the official design, giving the Pokemon a silver body with metallic skin. It’s likely that the Pokemon community will keep drawing the most popular creatures of the franchise in even more different styles, as this seems to be a very popular trend among fans.
